paragraphs.content: Chapter 39
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 39

paragraphs.content: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

paragraphs.content: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

paragraphs.content: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.

paragraphs.content: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

paragraphs.content: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

paragraphs.content: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

paragraphs.content: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

paragraphs.content: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?

paragraphs.content: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?

paragraphs.content: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

paragraphs.content: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

paragraphs.content: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;
paragraphs.contentHtml: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;

paragraphs.content: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

paragraphs.content: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.
paragraphs.contentHtml: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

paragraphs.content: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.

paragraphs.content: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

paragraphs.content: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

paragraphs.content: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

paragraphs.content: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.

paragraphs.content: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

paragraphs.content: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

paragraphs.content: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

paragraphs.content: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

paragraphs.content: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

paragraphs.content: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
